alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 5:55PM CDT until August 19 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central East Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... East Central West Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 800 PM CDT. * At 555 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 4 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Port Allen and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 3 and 8. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-4 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge
